text: Draft at AlÂ’s of Hampden. Pours cloudy yellow with a white head. Leaves some lacing in the glass. Big pine on the nose. Lots of pine needle and bark on the tongue. Finished clean. Nice!
Draft. Hazed gold pour. Great floral citrus aroma. Flavor is too malt forward at first but then juicy and citrusy. Lots of fresh malt flaovrs of oat and barley but no sweetness.

From can, poured a slight hazy golden colour with a white head. Nose of plain malts, Bread, oats, citrus notes, grass notes, crackers, tangerine and zest. Taste is Bread malts, citrus and light orange tangerine fruit. Clean crisp mouthfeel. Nice
A: Yellow coloured with a big white head N: Dandellions, pear, apple T: Oaky, dandellions, pine O: I prefer fruity IPA, but this is quite allright.

Pours a totally hazed medium gold with a big frothy white head and some light lace. Aroma of ripe honeydew melon, orange peel, fresh and leafy, subtle pine, a hint of sweetness to quite neutral malts. Flavour is rather dry and crisp, with notes of mixed citrus peels, minty leafy hops, fairly subtle tropical character of melon and kiwi, malts are pretty clean, slightly fuller mouthfeel from oats I suppose. A hint of cracker. Finish is low bitterness, mineral, lingering minty notes and citrus. Light to medium bodied, soft but spritzy carb, refreshing stuff overall if not mega-complex.

Fat pÃ¥ War Pigs efter MBCC 2017. Djupgul, disig vÃ¤tska. FrÃ¤scha och uppfriskande toner av citrus, grÃ¶nt humle, grÃ¶nt grÃ¤s, vete, ananas, apelsin, citron. Lite lÃ¤ttare med en frÃ¤sch och torr beska. OerhÃ¶rt hÃ¶g drinkabilitet. Grym NE-APA.

Can at Warpigs. Pours a hazy pale yellow with a thin white head. Grapefruit, tropical, unripe bitter fruity notes, very green, pine, grassy. The grass becomes almost drying but overall a very pleasant and well executed pale ale.

Keg at Ratebeer Best Beer Festival. 31/01/2016. A hazed yellow/ straw coloured pour with a loose white head. Aroma is dank hop, citrus lemon, grainy straw, wheat, little vanilla. Flavour is composed of raw base malts, wheat, juicy lemon, dank with a little mineral in the finish. . Palate is semi sweet, moderate carbonation, grainy. Xolid.
Relativ gelb und trÃ¼b, feiner weiÃŸer Schaum, leicht fruchtig hopfig in der Nase, relativ leichter KÃ¶rper, fruchtiger Abgang

Can from bytemesis. Pours hazy yellow. Unfortunately suffering from a cold so canÂ’t smell much. Taste is easier to detect - medium bitterness comes through, seems to be some citrus or typical fruit. Kind of resiny in the finish? Again, cold isnÂ’t helping.
Solid, brittle dry Pale. Not overtly punchy, lots of lime, some tropical fruits and kiwifruit. Very carbonation.

On tap at BGH. Pours a beautiful cloudy orange amber. Wet orange on the nose. Extremely light bodied. Very drinkable but weak palate. Pretty good still. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Can... Cloudy straw-colored pour with a slice of creamy, white foam at the top. Good retention. The aroma features big-time grapefruit with a lesser medley of tropical fruits. Light to medium-bodied with airy carbonation. The flavor features grapefruit bitterness and crackery breadiness. Finishes astringent and Sahara-dry. Can courtesy of biggsbowler!

Chalky golden with a nice haze and frothy white head. Complex citrus and dry pine hop aroma and flavor. Straight forward and crushable. 

Notes: On tap at the Tired Hands Fermentaria, Apt Â’17

Strong citrus aroma. Light gold and very hazy in color with nice head. Taste is citrus, hints of pine and resin
 Smooth clean finish, easy drinking

Aroma is lightly overripe mandarins with grass and earth. Taste is light dusty malty with ripe oranges and day old grass clippings. IÂ’m not as impressed as the rest of the world with this one. Drinkable for sure, but way too "low" in the taste spectrum.

Can 16fl.oz. [ As Tired Hands HopHands ].Unclear medium yellow color with a average to large, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, white head. Aroma is moderate to heavy malty, sweet malt, moderate to heavy hoppy, citrus, grapefruit, herbs, tropical fruit - kiwi. Flavor is moderate to heavy sweet and bitter with a long duration, fruity hops, pale malt, tropical fruit - kiwi, citrus. Body is medium, texture is oily to watery, carbonation is soft. [20161230]
 8-4-8-4-16

Draft @ Mikkeller & Friends, Copenhagen. Pours a hazy golden color with a small white head. Has a fruity malty bretty citrus hoppy aroma. Fruity malty peachy citrus hoppy flavor. Has a fruity malty peachy hoppy bitter citrus finish.
Tap at Tired Hands Fermenteria, Ardmore. Colour is very cloudy golden with small white head. Aromas and flavours: Fruits, some spices, hops and malts. Super fruity and super fresh.

A hazy yellow beer with a white head. The aroma has notes of lemons, straw, malt, hops, and spices. The flavor is sweet with notes of lemons, hops, and straw, leading to a very bitter finish. The body is light.

Can at home. Pours hazy pale yellow with a medium white head that leaves quite a lot of lacing. Aroma is tropical, lots of kiwi, really fresh. Taste is citrus, tropical fruits, kiwi, a bit of floral notes and a nice pine bitterness. Really good pale ale.

A medley of citrus and tropical fruity notes, some orange, peach, grapefruit, pale malt, some pine needles, clean hoppy into the finish.

Tap. Cloudy pale yellow body with a small white head. Aroma of citrus, caramel notes, floral too and pine. Sweet flavor that ends up being dry and nice bitter. Medium bodied, watery to oily texture and soft carbonation. A very crisp and excellent APA. ðŸŒŸðŸŒŸðŸŒŸðŸŒŸ

Can @ Johns. Pours pale yellow with a white head, lacings. Aroma of light malt, fresh fruity hops, melon, kiwi, light spicy hops, citrus, little pine. Flavor is light bitter, light malt, grass, rich fruity hops, citrus, pine. Medium body, average carbonation, dry and lasting bitter finish. 301216

Can. Slightly hazy yellow with medium white head. Aroma is malt, fruit, hops, citrus and a little tropical fruit. Flavour is malt, fruit, hops, citrus, tropical fruit, little sweet, juice and a medium bitter.
Can. Creamy White good mostly lasting head. Moderate malty and moderate hoppy aroma. Moderate bitter flavor. Average moderate bitter flavor. Long heavy bitter finish. Creamy palate.

Can @ Saxo tasting. Hazy golden with a lasting white head. Aroma is sweet, malty and moderate hoppy - citrus and fruity. Flavor is medium sweet and moderate bitter. Dry and moderate bitter finish. 301216
Can @ Aarhus tasting, my place. Nice creamy head with excellent duration. Color is golden. Aroma and taste are rich hops, flowers, fruits, malt, pine and has a nice long bitter finish.
On tap at the Brew Cafe. Cloudy opaque light orange. Crisp bready texture. Lots of citrus and tropical fruit Easy drinking. Clean dry finish.
Can svarer by dedollewaitor, thanks buddy. Hazy golden body with a small white head. Hops, tropical fruits, light citrusy. Lovely.

Really bright, hazy yellow color with white head. Aroma has citrusy, floral hops and dough. Taste starts citrusy and bright, a bit yeasty, not very bitter. Medium body and carbonation. Quite good but a bit too yeasty.

Can @ Mikkeller Bar, Aarhus. Pours hazy orange with a white head. Pine and lemony fresh hoppy nose. Exotic and tropical. Dry and crisp with a lovely fruityness. Short mild bitter finish. Tasty and fun quaffer..

The aroma is full of hops, mango, kiwi, pine needles, pineapple, papaya and guava. The color is pale yellow and unfiltered. The taste is full of hops, mango, kiwi, pineapple, papaya, guava, mandarine, tangerine, oranges, lemon and lime. A nice beer but I would like to try this fresher but itÂ’s nearly impossible to try super fresh beer from the States in Europe.

Can with no date stamp. Unclear yellow/orange with a medium sized white head with good retention, lace and regeneration. Soft hoppy nose with citrus, pine, lychee, persimmon and light starch. The flavour has citrus, dry flowers, light dough, dusty hay, mild starch, peach and mild orange peel. Medium body, oily texture, fine carbonation, medium sweet and bitter with mild acidity. Dry hoppy finish. Soft and the balance is fine.

Can @ From Mikkeller Ã…rhus. Pours cloudy golden with a white head. Aroma of tropical fruits, juicy, quite chalky, light pine and resin, ripe peach loads of juicy character. Taste is quite mellow bitter with loads of tropical fruits, quite malty and a good body which suits it, light dusty. Maby a tad old.

0.473 can.   A very hazy, faded yellow color and a small, patchy, white head. Aroma of pines, citruses, and some resin - rather simple. Taste of hops, pines, grass, once again resin, delicate fruity sweetness - nothing particularly awesome or salient. A medium body, a creamy texture, and an average carbonation. Finish is medium long, and simple as well. Overall the beer is drinkable and pleasant but overly simplistic.

Can. Pours hazy yellow with a white head. Aroma of mellow citrus, sweet orange, tangerine, peach, mango and sweet papaya. Taste is sweet and mellow with a nice hop presence, citrus, orange, stone fruits and some bread. Awesome!
Draught at Tired Hands. Light in yellow body hoppy hazy and pretty good overall. Best of the night.
Delicious Pale Ale, easy drinking with Tons of Hop character, Hazy with a great mouthfeel
On tap at CBC Boston. Comes a hazy pale gold with a nice white head. Aroma of citrus and pine. Taste is grapefruit, pineapple, orange, pine, and malt. Very good.

Tap at Copenhagen Beer Festival in Boston (9-24-2016) showing cloudy whitish yellow with quickly dissipating white foam. 

The nose shows very subtle notes of lemon and pineapple.

The palate is lightly carbonated and medium bodied. Flavors of light zest with light lemon and pineapple but not much else.
Pours a pale yellow white lacing. Aroma is citrus, orange grapefruit and resin

Cloudy yellow with slightly off white head. Good retention. Nice citrus pineapple notes in the aroma but doesnÂ’t pop. Citrus pineapple follows through more in the flavor. Full palate. Good APA. Glad I finally got to try it.

Can, 1. A cloudy yellow beer with a medium size white head. Aroma is of fruity hops, especially pinneapple. Taste is medium sweet and medium bitter with fizzy carbonation. Medium bodied with a sweet fruity finish. Smooth hoppy character.

Can, 1 pint. Milky pale golden with a large, foamy offwhite head. Aromas of citrus hops, resin, pine. Medium to light bodied, moderate to fizzy carbonation. Medium to light sweet, medium bitter. Juicy fruity flavors into a sublte hoppy finish.
Poured from 16oz can, canned on 8/18. Pours a yellow haze. Smells like grapefruit, pineapple, grass, barnyard. Taste is overwhelming tropical. Lemon peel, super crushable beer.

On tap at the Fermentaria. It pours a hazy yellow color with a creamy white head. The aroma is flowery with grapefruit. The flavor has a little more depth with some melon, flowers and dry pale maltiness. Smooth body with pleasantly low bitterness. A nice APA.

Truly exceptional in every way. This pale ale is refreshing and full of flavor and aroma. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Drat at Torst, 6/17/16. Orange pour with a medium sized head. Pine hop aroma, some tropical fruit, orange zest, and a bit of grapefruit. Drinks really nicely. Hop components work excellently together. Just really quality, drinkable stuff.

Can: Thanks Jcartamdg: Served in a Chouffe glass:
Hazy bright yellow. Good white head.
Nose is hoppy, some hop fruits, crispy yeast, floral, light citrus, etc etc. Just good!
Crispy flavour of hops, yeast, hop fruit, light hop bitters, flowers, yellow fruit, delicious flavour!
Aftertaste is hoppy, hop fruity, light bitter, crispy. Yum yum!
Low carbo, creamy mouthfeel, more than just medium bodied.
Delicious!
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text: Can. Pours hazy lemon straw yellow with off-white head. Aroma is sweet lemony grapefruit. Taste is sweet hoppy very carbonated with a lemony grapefruit pine finish. I could drink a bunch of these.

On draft at Tired Hands Fermentaria. The pour is a foggy golden yellow, a bit pale with a nice white head and a good lace as it falls to a thicker collar. The aroma is very juicy. Lots of line and citrus in there before it rolls through a nice line bitterness. The flavor is good. There is a juicy hop right up front and a nice light bittering pine resin. The mouth feel is good. There is a thickness to it from the oats, and the carbonation helps it coat the mouth and longer nicely. This is a great pale ale.

Flight at Tired Hands with koleminer20. Aroma is juicy, pine, resin, dank, tropical fruit, real good. Appearance is ugly, straw yellow, white head, hazy. Taste is resin, pine, tropical fruit, not as juicy as I wanted, good. Mouthfeel is light to medium body, light crisp carbonation, bitter hop aftertaste. Overall, a great Pale.

Light hazy straw yellow with foamy white head... Aroma of citrus, lemon, floral notes... Flavor is light and grainy, lots of herbal and spicy hop notes... Some grassy notes... Decent 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Tap at the source with commonshawn, rosskyle, and samadouche. Pint glass. Hazy, lemonade like color with a white head. Bright and hoppy nose with plenty of pine and bitterness anticipated. Taste is hop forward with the pine resin and bitterness coming out. Sticky mouthfeel initially before leaving you with a lingering aftertaste that is in no hurry to abandon you. Assertive and hoppy without ruining your palette. Feels professional.

Tap at brewery with commonmac and rosskyle and samadouche. Hazy yellow with thick white head. Heavy citrus nose. Aggressive hops, fresh citrus, sharp thin bite. Finish is slightly tart. Good tropical flavors, a well done ale.
Tried multiple others before getting to this so it was a little underwhelming. Hazy, quickly fading head. Light hppy fruity. Juicy and drinkable.
Can thanks to Josh. Pours a cloudy yellow with medium frothy white head that lasts. The aroma is tropical fruit and dank hop. Medium mouth, pine, dank, tropical fruit, light bitterness, very good.

Fruit loop like hop aroma. Appearance has a hazy pale white color with a large head with great lacing and retention. Flavor has a pleasant hop character with notes of flowers, citrus and tropical fruit notes. Malt flavor is light with a grainy wheat flavor. Bitterness is clean. Mouthfeel is light with a medium high carbonation level. Overall, it's a great tasting beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Tap at churchkey. Pours cloudy yellow. Flavours lemon, yeast grapefruit. Taste med sweet.

Great beer overall. Looks and tastes more of a white IPA then a pale ale. Great hop aroma. Body is a bit to light for my licking, but it is a much better then the overly heavy bodies most companies have been coming out with. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Can from a trade. Nose is full of mushy fruit, almost banana, light cherry, moderately tropical and very inviting. Pour is a cloudy pale yellow with a small white head that makes a thin film on top. Taste is initially bitter with some crackery malt flavors. Some orange and citrus starts to come through in the flavor as it warms. overall a very nice and crushable beer.
Murky straw pour with bright white head. Great lacing. Aroma is yeast, grapefruit juice, and grass. Taste is grapefruit juice, pine, and a little yeast. Lasting bitterness. Medium body.
Solid all around apa. Slightly cloudy yellow straw color. Nice west coast flavors. First tired hands beer I had and was very impressed

Hazy yellow pour. Nose is dank hops, some citrus, dill, actually do get some kiwi as noted in the brewery deScription. Taste is dank hops, kiwi, citrus fruits, onion. Medium mouthfeel, dry bitter finish with light astringency.

Can thanks to Aaron. Pours milky yellow with a small white head. Aromas of tropical, hazy dank hops, juicy, pineapple, fresh hops. Taste is pineapple, grapefruit, fresh hops, grassy, dank hoppy, light resin.
Can @ Mikkeller bar, Aarhus. Hazy golden pour with a generous head. Notes of strax, dank hops, bitter, melon and grape. Super juicy and tasty!
Can. Pours cloudy pale straw with big white head. Nose and taste are kiwi, strawberry and citrus.

Pours a milky lemon with a foamy white head. Aromas of lemon juice, kiwi, gooseberry, grapefruit. Taste is very very fruity with a subtle hop bitterness. Mouthfeel is slightly creamy with moderate carbonation.

16 oz. can. Very pale yellow hazy body. Smell is tropical fruits, lemon, and some spicy hops. Taste is more aggressive and biting. Some tropical fruits, but more of the pine and spicy hops. Yeasty for a pale ale. Bitter without much of a malt character. Light body. Drinkable and pretty nice, but not an astonishing hop profile in the day and age of HF, TG, and TH pales.
Great APA. This brew needs to be drank from can and pored vigorously in an effort to enjoy the hop character. Tasty. Enjoy
Can from jtclockwork-thanks, James! Cloudy tan. Nose is earthy hops, mandarin orange, slight lime minerality. Taste follows. Fairly bitter with nice earthy, tropical, and citrus hops. Great stuff.
Truly a life changing beer. Not only do I want more I want to know how to make it.  ---Rated via Beer Buddy for Android

Aroma: citrus fruits, grapefruit, light grain malts, some grass. Appearance: hazy yellow, small, frothy, white head. Taste: medium bitter. Palate: citrus fruits, acidic, lime, bitters intensify, very dry and bitter finish. Overall: excellent APA, fantastic palate, lots of citrus fruits. Pint at Rattle Â’nÂ’ Hum 33rd, Manhattan.
Can shared by a friend. Cloudy amber pour with a thick white head. Aroma of malt, tropical fruit and creaminess. Malty flavor with tropical fruit accents before a grassy hop finish.
[1/31/16] Draught sample at RateBeer Best festival in Santa Rosa. Overripe fruity hops. Dry, bitterish. Medium-bodied. Nice and refreshing.
Can. Milky yellow pour with a white head. Citrus and lemon bouquet. Taste follows suit. Good body and mouthfeel. Super solid.

Poured a milky yellow color with aromas of light hops, onion, mango and some crisp malt. Flavors are malt, citrus, cat piss, clean malt this stuff is fantastic. Another solid beer and glad this is a pint can. Long live the tall boy!

Sample on tap at Ratebeer best. Very milky cloudy pale yellow pour with white head. Very dank aroma, nice onion, garlic, mango, funky hop. Taste is lightly bitter, very juicy, dank. Palate is light bodied with soft carbonation, creamy. Delicious.
On draft at Tired Hands. Really enjoyable. Nice flavors of grapefruit and other citrus - orange/lemon/etc.. Solid hop/pine presence but really smooth. Clean/crisp and really flavorful. Great beer.
Pours a pale yellow color with a white head. Citrus, floral, pine and biscuit flavors and aroma. Medium light body and average carbonation. Citrus and floral finish.

Tap at fools gold for lunch after a spending spree at REI. Golden pour fine head. Nose is floral and tropical. Tastes of grapefruit, grassy, some peach, lychee, kiwi, florals and peppery. Nicely carbonated. Slight spice on finish.

Sample from growler. Pours a cloudy yellow-gold color with a medium thin white head that dissipates steadily to a sparse outer ring. Short strings of lacing on the glass. Aroma of tropical fruit, hops and malt. Light-bodied with flavors of citrusy hops, melon and biscuit malt. The finish is mildly bitter with a lingering fruity hops aftertaste. Pretty good all around.

Draft at Churchkey. Poured a hazy golden color with a small off-white head. Aroma was light citrus notes, touch of orange and pine. Light pine, very delicate citrus. Light resin, but not overly hoppy. Very tasty.
On draft at Churchkey during the 2015 Oerebbuak Abraxax Launch Party. Pours a hazy gold with an off white head. Juicy citrus nose. Flavors of orange and pine resin. Nice.

Tap. Fluffy white head, hazy bright citrus gold. Tropical fruit, berries, slight scallion in the aroma. Flavor is missing the scallion luckily, and sweet mango, tropical fruit and berries shine though. Lighter to medium slick body.
From a tap at the brewery. A cloudy yellow with nectarine honeysuckle and grapefruit. A good pale ale.

14 oz pour on draft at ChurchKey, served in a becher glass. 5.5% ABV batch. Murky yellow with off-white head. Aromas of tropical fruit, citrus, floral, lemon zest. Tastes of grapefruit citrus, tropical fruit, floral and grassy notes, slightly tart oranges. Medium body with a dry finish. Fantastic well put together pale!
Sample on draft. Some notes of hop, pine, yeast and pineapple. Not a bad brew overall, just a bit thin for me.

Pours a hazy golden color with a dissipating foam head that laces my glass. The aroma has notes of pine, tropical fruit, bread, citrus, and a good floral scent. Tasting, there is a pleasant bitterness, mango tropical fruit, sweet grains, and citrus. The hophand has a light to medium body and a enjoyable finish. Overall a nicely done ale. I would welcome this again.
Growler from fermenteria. Big citrus notes, light grass, very light carb. Pineapple juice. Really awesome!

Barcade, St. MarkÂ’s: pours hazy yellow with a white head. Aroma is nice and fruity with plenty tropical fruit and the like. Taste is not very bitter, but the hops have much flavor. Nice body and consistency.

Draft. Extremely cloudy yellowish gold with a little white head. Intense citrus fruits, grass, and a little bready malt. Light body and carb. Outstanding.Earlier Rating: 4/18/2015 Total Score: 3.9Draft. Light gold with white head. Lots of citrus and tropical fruit. Light body. Exceedingly drinkable with great balance of flavors.

Growler thanks to mom and cousin Deb. Pours out a cloudy golden color with a small white head. Aroma is of citrus hops, grainy bread, light floral notes,taste is juicy citrus hops, some light tropical flavors, light pine. Really nice, easy drinking pale.
Tap @ Proletariat New York. Hazy yellow amber, reasonable head. Pine hop aroma sweet grapefruit hop flavour. Sharp with bitter citrus aftertaste. Solid pale ale.

On keg in Torst, Brooklyn. Slight hazy looking amber, with a white head. Nose is huge fresh green acidic hops, pine, lots of acidic hop resin, but then some softer fruitier flavours of tropical fruit, mango, pineapple, passionfruit, and some mint. Taste is crisp, minerally, big acidic green leafy hop, pine and lots of softer tropical fruit. Very citrousy bitter with a lot of hop resin bite.

Hazy orange looking beer. Floral aroma with passionfruit and apricot notes. Taste of heavy citrus hops with pineapple and some mango, a bit grassy and spruce on the end, semi-dry with a creamy medium body. Great Pale Ale.

On tap at Omnipollos Hatt. 

Hazy yellow with a white head. Aroma and taste of hops, grapefruit, pineapple and som hay. Really fresh (only five days old) and nicely drinkable. The body was medium as was the bitterness.

Tap at Omnipollos Hatt. Pours hazy yellow with a white head. Aroma of tropical fruit, orange zest, mango and some grain. Dry taste of the same citrusy tropical notes, orange zest, mango and grain. Dry piney finish. Overall very nice and fruity.

Keg at Omnipollos Hatt, Stockholm.  Cloudy golden, mid sized head. Fruity nose with some grapefruit. Mid sweet with medium body and rounded mouthfeel. Orange peels, bread, sweaty lychee and sugared tangerines. Mid bitter finish. Ok, but lacks oomph and drinkability.

November 3, 2015. On tap at Omnipollos Hatt. 
Cloudy yellow with a small creamy white head. Aroma is fruity with orange zest, pineapple, hints of peach, hints of grass and slightly dank. Taste is light to medium sweet, medium bitter. Finish is light sweet with mango, some pineapple, peach, dry grassy and light piney medium bitterness. Light to medium bodied, average carbonation, somewhat oily texture. 
Very nice fruity and hoppy APA with high drinkability.

Draught. Hazy deep hay yellow liquid with medium off-white head. Aroma of lemon, tangerine, pineapple, lychee, mango, light grain and weed. Taste is dry and light to medium bitter with notes of mango, tangerine, light grain and pineapple. Very juicy and fruity. Light to medium bodied with medium carbonation. Very drinkable. Super nice. Very fruity and juicy. Just delicious.
On tap at Fermentaria. Poured a hazy golden color with a smaller sized head. Some pine, citrus, and lighter fruitiness.

Draft. Rich, loamy aroma of white truffle. Flavors of less dank earth that mushroom and truffle, with some underlying citrus sweetness that pushes through before giving way to more truffle. Finishes surprisingly dry. A stunner.
Draft at the fermentaria. Hazy pale yellow, just like everything else they had on tap. Aroma is floral, tropical fruits, soapy. My least favorite of the bunch I tried, but still decent.
Tap, gold pour, white head, nose and taste are grapefruit, pretty good apa here

Draught @ Modern Times Festival of Dankness, San Diego, CA

Pours hazy yellowish with a smooth head. Aroma of juicy tropical fruits, dank wet hoppiness, citrus, lemon, grapefruit. Taste is juicy, lemony and citrusy with some grapefruit. Finish is smooth and juicy. Tasty and refreshing.
Draft. Medium white head atop cloudy straw body. Aroma is medium sweet, skunk/grass, light pine. Taste is medium sweet grass, some skunk, orange/grapefruit. Soft light-medium body, light acidity.

Cloudy yellow bubbly white head ; aroma is hop spice pine; flava is mildly hoppy blended with fruit and grain notes of citrus and wood ; feels light to medium nice fizzy zing; finishes dry mildly bitter wood notes

Draft on 7/14/15. Pours a super hazy straw with a fluffy white head that lingers only slightly. Nose citrus, lemon, fruit. Taste is buttery cream, more fruit and bright citrus flavors. Light caramel. Soft mouthfeel. Pretty good

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Growler thanks to phillycraft. Very cloudy dull yellow pour with a nice 1 finger head that fades to a messy ring and leaves nice lacing. Great aroma of kiwi, pine, mandarin orange, and peaches. Tastes ultra smooth. A touch of sweetness and no bitterness. Big kiwi, nice amount of pine and peaches. Medium body. Very nice APA.

Pour on tap at the brewery, hazy orange pour with white head, aroma brought nice mix of orange, grapefruit juice with some lemon into a bit of tropical fruit, slight zesty, floral hops with a hint of bready notes. Taste was a fruity mix of lemon, orange, grapefruit into a bit of pine, some mango notes into a bit of bread, some spicy, zesty notes, finishing bitter, slightly dry.
Delish. Notes of orange, grapefeuit, kiwi, dankness. Taste is super juicy and slight bitterness. Great brew.

New England Bucket List Trip #242. Pours a hazy orange with a large creamy white head. Good head retention. Aroma of earthy, citrus, tropical hops, pale malt, floral and dandelion notes. The taste is tropical, piney, citrus, floral hops and pale malt. Medium bodied, strong lingering bitterness.
Full flavored APA. Raw hop flavor from the Amarillo. Very pale color again. Resinous and bass flavors. Light cereal sweetness but fairly dry. Hop showcase.

Growler from IP trade with AirForceHops. Thanks, Chris! Pours orange gold with a big white head that clings. Aroma is biscuits, grapefruit, tangerine. Flavor follows. Biscuits, tangerine, grapefuit and grapefruit peel bitter in the finish. Dry and easy drinking. Very nice.
On tap at Tired Hands. Poured murky pale yellow with thin white head. Aroma mild citrus yeast. Light carb med bod. Taste is light all around resin citrus.
UPDATED: FEB 3, 2016 Pours hazy yellow with thick white head. Smell is pine, hops and citrus. Taste is earthy grass, pine, resin and citrus. Light body, medium carbonation.

Pours light orange with a one finger white head with nice lacing. Aroma is of citrus, tropical fruits (kiwi), pine, and some light bready malts. Taste is similar to the aroma with a lot of fresh citrus, tropical fruits, berry, and light bready malts. Has a medium body with a semi creamy mouthfeel and a semi dry, semi-moderately bitter, medium-long finish. Overall, a great APA that is both complex and drinkable.

UPDATED: DEC 7, 2015 Very nice pale ale here. Lots of piney aroma, with a great straw-like malt backbone. Citrus and soft florals. Soft carbonation. Light bitter finish. Hazy gold with ok head and lacing. I could drink this all day.

Growler from TH. Pours a light yellow gold straw color with a beautiful frosty white head. Aroma of fresh hops, kiwi, grapefruit, line pine and funk notes. Taste of juicy fresh hops, kiwi, grapefruit and light pine. Excellent, refreshing and juicy.

Draft at Monks. Hazy yellow gold pour with soapy white foam. Splashes of lace. Huge grassy, citrus hop flavors. Grapefruit. Lemon zest and seeds. Green banana peels. Chanterelles. Parsley. Artichoke hearts. Passionfruit. Clementines. Juicy body with a very bitter finish. Tastes fresh and lovely.

Growler from Tired Hands. Pours a hazy yellow with a creamy white head. Juicy fruit forward hop aromas with kiwi, mango, pineapple and pear. Med body with more fruit forward hop flavors - thinning on the back end with more floral and citrus notes on the finish. Excellent!!!

On tap at Tired Hands.
Appearance: Milky straw body. Creamy white head.
Aroma: Pineapple is prominent with orange peel and hints of pine. Nice aroma, good strength.
Taste: Pineapple is prominent, mildly bitter with pine, light malts and sweet orange.
Palate: Creamy soft body.
Overall: Excellent pale ale, fruity and flavorful. Very easy to drink.

Growler from the source next day, thanks David. Pours a slightly hazy yellow with a thin white head. Aroma is kiwi, mango, tangerine, grassy hop, pine. Taste is so bright, light and fruity.. Really great. Such smooth, airy and wonderful stuff. On point

On draft at the brewpub. Pours a hazy light straw color with a small foamy white head. Aroma of sweet citrus fruit, grass, and pineapple. Taste of citrus, light pine, white bread, lemon rind, and yeast.

Via Growler (within 24hrs)

Aroma - nice citrus grapefruit, lemon, and Centennial hops.
Appearance - body color is yellow; liquid is in between hazy and cloudy; the head sets up about 1 1/2" and is white and fades into nice foam layer; great lacing
Taste - is a nice mixture of Centennial and grapefruit, lemon, and a nice Crystal malt.
Palate - body is light to medium; the texture is nice and hoppy, but not oily; carbonation is average; the finish is a nice bitter quality that isnÂ’t over the top.

Draft at Tired Hands. Pours gold with decent white head. Big aroma with great tropical citrus, floral notes. Pine flavor comes through strongly with good balance by a sturdy malt backbone. Again, big citrus presence here. Well made beer.

Pour is cloudy yellow with a cloying head. Aroma is very aromatic. Hoppy and citrus. Excellent balance in this beer. Very nice beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Draft. Hazy golden pour with white head. Herbal and piney hop aromas. Flavor is pine and herbal tones with light sweetness, reminds me of something but I canÂ’t put my finger on it.

Growler from brewpub. Cloudy straw colored with soapy white head. Floral, tea, tangerine, tropical fruits, grapefruit. Moderately bitter and sweet. Light carbonation on top of smooth medium body. Could drink this all day.
Growler poured a hazy apricot color. Smell of brett and hops. Light bitterness and citrus. Smooth with a clean finish
Growler. Light citrus aroma. Taste of citrus pith and very light bread flavors. Assertive bitterness, light body, very gentle creamy mouthfeel. This is my type of beverage.
Sharpness of hop punch. Murky yellow, very easy and enjoyable to drink. Notes of oats. Great pale ale!

One liter growler thanks to Reggie Dunlap, thanks Kerry! Hazy yellow with fleeting white head. Pleasing nose of lemon, grapefruit and pine notes. Flavor is an extension of the nose with the addition of nice grain, bread type pale malts and dry herbal tones in the finish. Fresh cut grass and the herbal flavor lingers slightly after the sip. Bitterness lingers for a decent amount of time after the sip. I see why the brew master has rebrewed this APA. Highly drinkable and You can knock back multiple glass real easy. I killed the one liter growler with ease. 
Personal note: this was my number 100 rate of American Pale Ales and also my 100th rated beer from the state of Pennsylvania.

Growler split at Dadsgiving, big thanks to Dallas for muelling this one north, 24/11/13.
Hazed light orange with a thin off white covering.
Nose is dank hops, grapefruit, mandarin, grass, light spice, earthy.
Taste comprises dank hops, grapefruit, orange pith, bitter mandarin, light pine dipped straw.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, dry grassy bitterness in the finish.
Nice work - solid APA.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Growler from the brewery. Pours a hazy pale orange with a white head. Hoppy aroma of grass, grapefruit, tangerine zest. Taste is crisp and slightly bitter with a crisp finish like orange rind. The mouthfeel is like water and the carbonation is high. Super refreshing and an easy drinker.
4oz sample at the brewery. Pours a hazy yellow with some creamy, white head. Nose is grassy, herbal, grapefruit, lemon, pine, soap. Zesty flavor, light onion, lemon, pine, light malt. Zesty finish.

Really light and citrusy. Lots of pineapple and lemon and a little earthy too. Very easy to drink.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

A: Golden Straw Hue, Passes Lots of Light, White Head Ring, Some Lacing

S: Piney, Citrus, Mild Bready

T: Piney, Mild Citrus, Mildly Malty

M: Average Carbonation, Medium Bodied, Mild Bitter

Overall, a pretty solid APA with a nice bitter Finish.

On tap at the brewery. Hqazy orange pour wit ha white head. Aroma is citrus, orange, grapefruit, hints of pine. Flavor is similar. Well balanced on all sides. Great hop notes with a good malt backbone. Good beer.

From a growler. Pours clear amber with a small head. The aroma is outstanding. Citrus and pine dominate with a bit of malt sweetness. The flavor has a bit of malt up front and the hops coming later. The finish is very dry.
Aroma of overripe clementines, pine trees, and orange zest. Pours clean and blonde with a medium head. Taste is juicy and bitter with nice lime, orange, and pine. Great IPA.

Aroma: hay, bread, resin, citrus, barnyard, earthy, pineapple, 
Appearance: golden orange, hazy, sparkling, medium white foam
Taste: medium Sweet, medium+ Bitter, light+ sour
Palate: Medium body, Average carbonation, Soft fizz, Astringent finish, long and bitter
On draft at TH. A fruity PA, with a pale green pour. This was very fresh & tasty - fresh bread, green hops, a little seaweed. An excellent APA, one of the best IÂ’ve had. Kudos to Tired Hands!

Growler from Chris. Thanks! Hazed golden pour with a white head. Really dank, piney nose. Biscuit malt, grapefruit, orange peel, and some floral notes. Dry, citric, and piney flavor. Tons if grapefruit and orange peel. Biscuit, some cracker, and pine bitterness. Very nice (Borat voice). Buzzed quick.

Yellow golden pour with a thin white head and thick banded lacing ... aroma of citrusy, piney hops and some pineapple ... taste is citrusy - pineapple, grapefruits and lightly piney ... dry simple and pleasantly bitter hopped on the backend and lingers into the finish ... solid very easy drinking pale ale

This one poured a cloudy darker yellow with a white head.Aroma was light fruit, light grain, and grass. Flavor was tremendously balanced between fruit hops, light grain, no sweetness at all thought. Very drinkable for sure.

On tap at the brewpub. Pours a hazy golden orange with a thick, frothy white head. Aroma of grassy hops, garlicky hops, tropical fruits, grass, caramel malt. Flavor of light garlicky hops, grassy hops, earthy fruits, a touch of light citrus fruits. Very hoppy, very flavorful, the best pale ale IÂ’ve ever had...(really itÂ’s an IPA)
8/4/9/5/15 (4.1/5)

Draft at Tired Hands. Pours a hazed gold with a cream white head. Nose is soft with low citrus peel, earthy malt. Very clean and crisp. On tasting, on the drier, thinner side. medium soft bitterness, pithy ugli fruit note and toasty malt. Clean and refreshing. Great APA.

A hazed blonde ale with a thin creamy lacing off white head. In aroma, an enticing mix of lemony and piney hops, with light tropical fruits, superb in mouth, a smooth crisp herbaceous malt with grassy and lemony hops, piney notes, quite nice.

A legitimately amazing APA, so much tropical and citrus fruit flavor bursting through the seams. Clean and easy to drink. A real contender to Alpha KingÂ’s throne, superior to all the Citra-forward stuff thatÂ’s popular now.

Soft straw blonde pour with a dense white head. Soft fruit in the nose with some light malty notes. 
Very nice flavor, lots of citrus and fruit showing. Light toasted grain with some earthy bready notes. Dry citrus rind. 
Very mellow bitterness and carbonation. Very nice and soft velvety mouthfeel from the oats. 
7/4/7/4/16

On tap at the brewpub. Nice that they keep the two stand-bys on deck at all times, and this was a well realized and quite dry APA. Light gold pour, with moderate cloudiness and an impressive head. Nose was piney, citric at times, with hints of cracked pepper and pungent flowers. Lively mouthfeel, very sessionable and refreshing. Flavors are slightly brighter and more floral than the nose suggests, but thereÂ’s still plenty of dry and peppery flavors in the finish especially. Nuanced session brew, well done.

32oz growler in a tulip. Pours cloudy golden with a lacy, off-white head. Aroma of fruity and citrusy hops, some light pale malts, and good doughy yeast. Flavor the same with lots of fruits and citrus. Average texture. A good pale ale.
From tap. Pours hazy yellow with a small white head. Aroma is citrusy, peachy and crisp hoppy. Smooth fruity, lingering hoppy and crisp. Mellow and fruity finish.
Overall a very nice crisp and balanced pale ale.  Nice juicy citrus and melon notes.  A bit of grass and pine and not bitter in the least.  Just really nice and drinkable.

Growler from maxime.  Thanks a ton for this tasty brew.  Notes of clean fresh pine. Tangerine.  Hint of resin.   Juicy.  No abrasive bitterness.  Hop forward for sure with a pleasant toasted cracker orangepeel sweetness provides pleasant balance.  Tight beer.
Yellow pour with white head and lace. Aroma is sour malt, earthy hops, and citrus. Light sweet malt, perfumy hops, dry finish, medium bitter. A tad thin and watery but a nice beer.

32 oz. swing top growler served in a Hill Farmstead glass. Filled 5/5.

A: Pours a clear golden yellow color with a pure white head forming on the pour. It recedes slowly to a thick collar that leaves sticky sheets of lace down the glass.

S: Grassy, floral with a little bit of lemon citrus. Sweet cracker malts provides a nice backbone for this. Nicely balanced.

T: A ton of floral and grassy-like hops on the initial sip. The mid palate has a very light touch of bitterness. Light white grape with a clean finish. The malt body is like a honey covered croissant. Sweetened, but not over powering.

M: Incredibly light with a medium carbonation level. Very clean and smooth across the palate with a very drinkability. This goes down so easy.

O: A really easy drinking and nicely put together APA. This isnÂ’t going to knock your socks off with flavor, but itÂ’s well made. Balanced.

Serving type: growler
Pours a nice gold color, white head.  Flavors of citrus hops, grassy hops, mandarin oranges, citrus peel, resin.  Damn good shit!

Tap flight at the brewery.  Full disclosure: this beer came after my plate of house made pickles. That said, the beer still tastes hoppy and delicious. Very light yellow pour with a pretty dense white head. Not much aroma or body. The taste is bright citrus hops with a good bitter bite. More body would make this really nice but I know thatÂ’s not what the brewer intended.

On tap at Tired Hands. If it wouldn't raise DUI suspicions, I would want to have a HopHands car air freshener. My girlfriend wouldn't be crazy about it, but I could breathe in this beautiful hoppiness all day. Oh yea...it tastes great too.

1L growler, sent from callmemickey (thanks a lot, Ryan), pours a cloudy golden-tinged yellow with a small white head. Aroma brings out loads of piney hops, a little citrus zest, and crackery malt - very pleasant pine-dominated nose, though itÂ’s a pretty subtle in the aromatics department. Flavour brings out loads of crackers, some mild piney hops, and a hint of citrus zest. Very clean and crisp, characterized by the front-and-centre crackery quality. Highly drinkable, refreshing and quite dry, with moderate hoppiness. Excellent thirst-quencher.

Growler @ the Mini-Tasting, Naples. Cheers to Crosamich for scoring this. The pourÂ’s light gold with a tiny white head. Light floral hop nose. A bit oÂ’ pee. Some lemon rind and general citrus. Hints of sweet canned pears. The taste is more of the same. Light pear and white grape. Moderate citrus hop bite. Super light palate. Only a touch of bready malt. Soft carbonation. Overall, pretty refreshing.

Pours a slightly hazy yellow, almost no head. Nose is piney with hints of tangerine and coconut. very nice mouth feel, very bitter and the ABV of 5.2% is of course barely noticeable. Clean finish, lovely pine cone. Very drinkable.

Growler. Light yellow pour with a nice white head. Great lacing on this one if youÂ’re kinky and into that sort of thing. Juicy fruit hop aroma. Flavor had some notes of lime zest that kep the beer from being one dimensional. Malt takes a backseat on this one. Clean finish, crisp, minimal bitterness. IÂ’m convinced, this brewery lifts.

Growler at home with Aaron. Pour is golden yellow with a fluffy white head and great lacing. Grassy, weedy, grapefruity, light citrus, biscuity, straw, a touch of earth, and dough in the aroma. Taste  is weedy, grassy, pungently juicy, tangy, biscuity, herbs, fruity, and light bread with a medium bitter finish. Medium body with high carbonation. Really nice session pale ale and a real treat to try.

Growler @ StephenÂ’s house. Big thanks! Pours a hazy yellow appearance with a white head. Spicy, garlic, onion, herbal hoppy, citrusy fruity aroma. Quenching, spicy, garlic, grassy floral, a bit piney, lemony, onion flavor. Delicious.

Draft at TH. 8 oz pour. Bright orange color, good head. Nose is tropical fruits, pine, grass, flowers.... Taste is tropical fruits, mango, piney, light flowers, very slight tartness in the end. Body is dry and light. Easy to drink. Overall: A nice american pale ale.

Growler, thanks Frank!  Pours very slightly hazed golden with plenty even white head that settles down to a uniform layer.  Tangerine citrus, some onion and a hint of cattiness.  Very light and balanced and with malt and yeast really just proping up the hop aromatics.  Light crackery malt, some peppery yeast character, slightly citrus and bitter hop finish.  Drinks super easy.
Nose of tangerine floral notes danky and crackery malts. Pours golden great head and lace. Flavors of citrus tangerine dank crackers and pale malts. Super drinkable dry ans hoppy..very quenching.

Growler shared by GT2 at RBWG welcome dinner.  Cheers, GT!  Pours a hazy yellow with a white head.  Nose is tangerine, orange, citrus, and light pine.  Flavor follows with a bit of fruit, orange, tangerine, slight pine, and some caramel.  Light to medium in body and a nice pale overall.

On tap at the brewpub. Not surprised to see that this gets a 100% for style at the time of rating and before having looked at any Tired Hands ratings, it was easily my favorite of the seven small beers I tried. Aroma beams forth with good tropical hop resins, steady and sturdy. Flavors start with the ethereal light and fresh green hop qualities and then merge beautifully into a n almost nutty malt base. One of the more broadly complex Pale Ales IÂ’ve had in awhile and I give it a lot of credit for being balanced, hop flavor delicious, and with malt nuance. ItÂ’s hard to pull that off. Yum.
Courtesy Jon D.  Pours clear golden, white rimming head.  Cat piss, grass, kiwi, pineapple orange, cotton candy.  A bit thin, but grass and cotton candy, mildly bitter.  Just grand.

Growler at Kickbacks for RBWG welcome dinner 
Mostly clear yellow with a white head.
Light citrus hop aroma.
Dry, bitter.
Decent for a pale ale.

Growler shared by GT2 at rbwg.  Another awesome ipa from
Gene.  No surprise there.  Lot of lighter citrus, soft lemon, orange creamsicle, zesty finish.  Want a keg of this for my refrigerator at home.

Swing top to taster at RBWG (thanks to whoever shared this). Looks gold and transparent with thin white lacing. Smells GOOD; nice and hoppy. Tastes like it smells, but milder. Average on the palate. A good example of the style.

Growler at RBWG. Pours clear, pale yellow with a fine, white foam head. Dry lemon in the nose. Light to medium sweet flavor, great balance, some lime, anise, lemon, dry pale malts, pine needles. Light bodied with fine carbonation. Very clean finish, lightly drying, light pale malt sugars, delicate lime. Really nicely balanced.

2/21/13. Growler at Kickbacks, RBWG Welcome Dinner! Light golden pour with a small khaki head. Light hop aroma with biscuits. Mild hop flavor, slight tropical and citrus, more light malts amd biscuit. Not bad.

This flippy top bottled brew from a rating party poured a very small sized head of frothy clear colored bubbles that were quickly diminishing and left behind a no visible carbonation slightly hazy light yellow colored body and a poor lacing. The mild aroma was malt hop. The mouth feel was weakly tingly at the start and at the finish. The mild flavor contained notes of crisp and hops. A decent one but not one that I would consider drinking again.
Smells like apricot and tropical floral cat piss. Light grainy with and ephemeral bitterness. Fruity bitterness, light, crisp, outstanding.

Growler courtesy of Ryan - thanks much! Pours clear pale golden with a large creamy white head that slowly dissipates with nice lacing. Aroma is citrus, pine, tropical fruit. Flavor follows nose, quite pleasant, very light sweetness and light bitterness becoming more pronounced in the finish. Light body with a bit of an oily mouthfeel. NIce and refreshing.
UPDATED: JAN 21, 2016 Can. Pours cloudy yellow with white head. Nose and taste of citrus, sugared lemon, grassy hops and light bready malt. Medium body.
Draft at the source. Aroma of light straw. Taste is bitter, peppery and dusty straw.

Draft at the brewpud during the Farm Hands release. Poured a pale yellow body with a foamy white head, easily the least impressive part of this beer was the apearance. Aroma starts to step it up with notes of lemon, cirus rinds, bread, grassy hops and a slight touch of white pepper. The body was damn super, so delicate overall with a lighter mouthfeel and soft carbonation that made you want to drink this all day long. Flavor of grains, toast, ligth drier lemon rind and yeast. Great beer that I could drink all day.
Draft at the brew pub. Pours hazy yellow with a medium sized white head. The aroma Is floral and soft.. Inviting. The taste is grassy, easy to drink, a little resin and earth in there.

Poured from a growler purchased at the brewpub.  Pours a cloudy yellow color with a white head.  Aroma is citrus, grapefruit, some garlic.  Medium on the palate with light carbonation.  Flavor is sweet, bready, yeasty, hoppy, grapefruit, with a light bitter finish.  Very tasty.

On tap at the brewpub. Tired Hands' flagship beer is smooth, light, rounded hops, highly drinkable. Pretty appearance too as the white head sticks around past its welcome. A tasty gateway drug to the other outstanding brews available here. Make your way to Ardmore if you love beer.

UPDATED: FEB 10, 2016 Enjoyed on tap at the brewpub. Hoppy aroma. Grapefruit coloured and lacey.  A little yeast, surprisingly.  A big smooth mouthfeel.  Citrus, a good pale.
Had it again 3 plus years later, still very good.

Pours golden-yellow with a big white head. Lots of sticky lacing. Big citrus hop aroma with nice sweet fruit there as well. Tons of hop flavor. Very drinkable. I get this one almost every time I visit the brew cafe.
UPDATED: DEC 17, 2012 On draft at the brewery, very flowery and citrusy, nice hop bite, artisan beer

Tap.  Aroma: loaded with floral and citrus hops, grass, grapefruit, melon, light bready malt notes, some yeast.  Pours light golden, fairly clear, big white head with good retention and lacing coats the glass.  Massive hop flavor - lots of citrus, melon, tropical fruit, some pine and resin, a touch of light malts and sweetness helps balance.  Medium bitterness, the focus stays on the hop flavors, fairly dry finish.  Medium body and carbonation, creamy mouthfeel.  Really great brew - these guys know what theyÂ’re doing with hops...

Growler received in trade. Thank you callmemickey! Pours clear pale golden with a huge frothy white head that leaves some sticky lacing on the glass while dissipating. Smell is slightly sweet, hoppy fresh and fruity with crackers, dried flowers, honeydew melon, kiwi fruit, tropical fruit hard candy, oily pine, sour melon gumdrops, freshly cut grass, grapefruit juice, yellow wine gums,Â Taste is slightly sweet, bitter, fruity and tiny herbal with crackers, oily pine, resinous wood, freshly cut grass, grapefruit juice, sour melon gumdrops, unripe kiwi fruit, star fruit, orange wine gums, lemon balm, lemon zestÂ and hints of lemony soap.Â Mouthfeel is soft, oily bitter, tiny watery and light bodied. Finish is tiny sweet, bitter, hoppy and slightly fruity with grapefruit juice, unripe kiwi, freshly cut grass, green grapes, honeydew melon, lemon zest, crackers and gooseberries. A great refreshing beer!

(Bottle) Pours clear pale golden with a creamy off-white head. The aroma holds boatloads of pine, black currant tea, melon bubblegum, kiwi, herbs, grass, litter box and flowers. Undertones of banana candy, Swedish snus and white bready malt. Clean and refreshing on the nose. The flavor is light sweet, medium bitter and tiny acidic with citrus, pine, fruits, grass, flowers, herbs, black currant and white bread. The mouthfeel is clean, soft, light astringent and light tart with a light to medium carbonation. Yummy, green hoppy aftertaste. Light to medium bodied.
Growler at Dadtoberfest. Pours gold with a white head. Light piney hops, floral notes, and a pale malty base. Light citric fruity notes. Very drinkable.

At Dadtoberfest.  The aroma is floral hops, citrus, caramel.  The appearance was a gold/copper color, white head.  The flavor was hop forward, citrus, flowers, caramel.  Medium in body.  Floral hops on the finish.  Nice beer all around.

On tap at Tired Hands. Beautiful aroma on this one. Apricot, grapefruit - juicy and delicious. Sweet and succulent. Cloudy pale golden with foamy lacing white head. Medium body with medium carbonation. Starts with big juicy hops. Fruity and spicy with clean finish. Right level of sweetness, bitterness, and carbonation. This is a phenomenal APA. Delicious.

Lightly hazy golden with a decent white head that lingers nicely... aroma is quite hoppy, nice notes of stonefruits and pine and a light mild pale malt sweetness.... Flavor is excellent, loads of flavor, lots of fruits and subtle earthy hops and lightest malts... medium thin body easy drinking, excellent pale ale
growler supplied by James at Dadtoberfest  - a solid pale ale on the hoppy side. Sweet caramel malts with some breadiness. Dry hop notes of citrus and flower petals. Piney, dry finish.

Draught- pours slightly hazy yellow gold w/ big white head. Good retention & lacing. Aroma of pungent hops, citrus, slight lemon, slight pine. Taste is citrusy hops, bitter pith, clean grain. Body is light/ medium. Very sessionable. Finish is mildly bitter.

Growler courtesy of Jdadmond at his place for Dadtoberfest.  Pours a lightly hazed gold with a thin white head.  Spicy hops, a touch of crisp malt, cool citrus, lemon and sweet candied citrus peels.  Medium bodied, grainy and a touch of malt.  Long grainy malt and quick bitterness.  Tasty enough.
On tap at the brewery. Pours a hazy gold with some head. Aroma is dank grapefruit. Taste is a bit thin. Hop flavor doesnÂ’t stay through. Picking up an odd peanut flavor.

Very pale for a pale ale, looks more like a wheat, white small head with tight bubbles. Lots of carbonation. Aroma: WOW! Very fresh hoppy aroma of pine, citrus, grapefruit, orange, just like fresh squeezed hop juice. Taste is very nice, hoppy with pine, fruits, bitterness, grassy, very fresh taste, i get almost no malts. A VERY nice APA and just as I ewant it. This and Mo is my favorites among APAs so far! =)

On tap at the brewpub. Pours a hazy yellow. Two fingers of head and little lacing. Lemon and grass aroma with some lighter fruit that I can't pinpoint. Smoooooooooooth mouthfeel. Perfect carbonation and extremely  drinkable. taste of fruit mango, tart lime, orange, grass and pineapple. This is just a flavorful, light, clean,dry, drinkable APA. Damn good all around!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Growler shared at CAH. Thanks, Steve. Pours a pale light straw color with nice head that left somelacing. nose is mild cumquat and melon.  first sip is nice pale malt balance and mild piney hops. finish is clean with just a hint of orange peal. very nice beer.

On tap at Tired Hands.  Clear yellow with a white,fluffy head.  Nose is catty hops and grass; slightly sweet.  Beautifully creamy with a light tingle.  Nice musk and citrus peel with a delicate sweetness.  Top notch.

UPDATED: AUG 11, 2012 tap at brewpub. Hazy gold, thick frothy white head that laces everywhere. Super bright nose, ultra resinous with heavy orange, light sweetness with a few off paper hints. Flavor shows ultra bite, orange candies and earth slowly disappear across mid as beer dies in a dry, doughy end, absolutely no sugar anywhere, though salty orange returns in finish. Breezy and airy, it brings wonder and then disappears, teasing in that delicious, "I want more" way.

Tap at Tired Hands. Chill hazed light gold pour. Thick, sheety lace. Dense pillowy head retention. Mega dank tropical melon hop nose. Big cantaloupe and mango. Similar to Pliny the Younger. Taste is very dry and fully grassy bitter. No sugar or syrup or astringency. Very dry finish with full grassy bitterness. Delicate. Small malt richness and oatmeal as it warms. Very delicious.

Pale orange witha a white head.  Aroma is fresh fruit, light pine, flora, and soft biscuit. Medium bodied. Flavor is citrus, fresh fruits, light floral, a bit of sweet biscuit malts, and light pine. Finish has a nice lingering bitterness.  A real winner of a pale.

UPDATED: DEC 29, 2012 Draft at tired hands with pat, Von and Allen. Pours a beautiful hazy lemon orange body with thick one finger creamy head and spotty white lacing. Aroma is fresh citric hops, light funk, lemon, and tangerines. Mouthfeel is soft and delicate with notes of fresh citrus, light grapefruit, tangerines, clementines, and a perfect bitterness that makes this pale ale insanely refreshing and drinkable. +0.2 from original tasting. One of the strongest offerings from TH.

Hazy dark golden color with a medium sized, off white head that left nice lacing on the glass. Aroma of floral hops, pine, citrus grass, and light malty notes. Taste of citrus, pine, grass,orange, light resin, and a lightly bitter finish.
on tap-pours pale yellow with a white head that laces.  Aroma is citrus, some light malt.  Taste is citrus/pine hops, dry, some light malt.

On tap at Tired Hands. Pours clear Pilsner light golden with a two-finger white head which recedes to leave a fuzzy ring around the edge and atop the surface. Aroma of a box of brand new Fruit Loops, dry, aromatic grass, moist wood, lemon, orange, and musty earth. Taste is soft lemon meringue, lime, dry, wonderfully bitter hop resin, and some mild, fresh orange at the back. Mild to light bodied with a smooth, creamy, crisp palate. This APA is smooth as hell and incredibly restrained, elegant and delicious. A fantastic ale in every way.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: AUG 23, 2012 On tap at tired hands. Pours a slightly clearish golden color with impressive lacing and small head. Aromas and taste of strong citrus, pine, melons, grapefruit juice, earthy and herbal grains. Fresh as can be, drinks like water. I have had this a few times since the first couple and it seems to be inconsistent. It even tasted way better upstairs then it did downstairs a couple weeks ago. Bizzare.

UPDATED: JUL 13, 2012 8 oz at Tired Hands. Pours golden with thin white head. Nose is floral, resiny, citrus, with sweet malts. Taste is grapefruit, pine, grass. Solid pale

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Served on-tap at the brewery.

A - Pours pale golden yellow with a nice one finger tall white head leaving spotty streaks of lace down parts of the glass.

S - Smells of plenty of grassy hops, pine resin, citric rind and just the faintest hint of sweetness. Nothing too over the top here, pretty solid.

T - Starts off with plenty of grassy hops and slightly dulled citric rind giving way to hints of pine resin, pale malt and just the faintest bit of sweetness. Finish has plenty of hop bitterness, leaving the palate dried long after the finish.

M - Nice light feel with a crisp body and moderate carbonation. Bitter but not overpowering, this is very easy going down.

O - All things considered a really nice APA. I personally prefer Leaflet to this one but I wouldnÂ’t turn this down in the future.

Pours a pale gold with little to no head. Aroma of citric and piney hops. Taste follows with tropical fruit notes. Light and easy to drink. Great hoppy summer beer

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Draft at the brewpub, pours straw gold with a white head.  Dry, herbal hops, more pronounced than in the Foliage as they had more room to really express themselves.  Long, dry herbal finish.  Good, drinkable, but I just didnÂ’t find either of the pale ales tonight to really "pop" like a great pale ale does.  Kind of singular and not a particularly bright expression.  I liked it but I think it falls well short of what I would call a great pale ale.

On tap at Tired Hands.  Pours a light yellow-straw color with a good head.  Nice lacing.  The nose is exceedingly complex and strong for a beer of this size with fantastic citrus rind, light pine, and hints of tropical fruit.  Flavor has a malty dryness to accompany the hop bitterness.  Flavor packs in fresh citrus peel along with a light dosing on pine needles and a faint earthy dankness, which must be the Columbus speaking.  Body is light and crisp.  Uber drinkable.  I see many growlers of this in my future.

UPDATED: MAR 19, 2016 Bright straw yellow body.  Moderate sized white head and solid lacing. Nose is full of restrained pine, resin, grass, oranges, and a bit of lemon.  Flavor leans toward the piney-grassy end of things and is complemented by a light grainy undercurrent.  Medium bodied, assertive carbonation, dry, mildly bitter finish.  Impressive APA.

Rankings for cask versions from Magick ManÂ’s Friday night casks:
1. Simcoe (5/3/13)
2. Mosaic (5/10/13)

Pours a clear bright yellow with a medium white head.  Aroma has nice soft stonefruits and light grassy and pine notes.  Flavor steps up the pine a bit...some spicy hop notes, soft and faintly bready pils malt backing but solid bitterness.  Mouthfeel is light and silky and the finish is piney and dry.  Bravo Jean!!

UPDATED: JAN 29, 2014 pale straw color, fairly clear, nice creamy head that hangs around until the end and leaves nice lace.  aromas of grapefruits, light limes, fresh, earthy wild spring onions in a field of grass, and pine. very dry, very hoppy.  good clean grain backbone comes during the finish.  phenomenal flavors that follow the nose, except more grapefruit, earth, and soft lime. beautifully dry and refreshing while maintaining a very flavorful palate.

Aroma of resin, floral, grass, earthy hops; mild unripe fruit.cloudy. Appearance is pale cloudy golden with light orange hue. Large frothy off white head slowly fades to a thin collar and thin webs of lace. Crisp body, medium full, fluffy carbonation, light crisp finish. Slightly peppery and spicy from the start with a light fruit sweetness through the body and an excessively bitter and dry finish. Not much subtlety here for a sub 5% ABV APA.

Tap at TND.  Pours a hazy pale golden yellow with a medium bubbly white head that left sticky lacing.  Aroma of fresh American hops.  Citruy with light pine and tropical fruit notes.  Flavor of the same resiny American hop profile.   Dry and bitter.  Lots of tropical fruit in the flavor profile as well.  This is awesome.  So fresh, so hoppy and so dry!

Draught at TND:  Aroma of hops, pine, citrus, resin, and slight grass.  Poured pale yellow/straw in color with a small, creamy, loose, rocky, white head that diminished but lasted throughout.  Cloudy.  Slightly sparkling.  Full of tiny-sized particles throughout.  Flavor is heavily bitter.  Tastes of hops, grass, light pine, light citrus, resin, and a hint of yeast.  Medium body.  Tingly, then dry texture.  Average to lively carbonation.  Heavily bitter, hop, pine, grass, resin finish is dry.  A nice local APA/IPA.
